result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

OFF RECORD/ 10:22 AM Defendant Mariah Renae Trepania not in court.  Attorney David L. Christian in court for Mariah Renae Trepania.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Case to track with 22CF170.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mariah Renae Trepania in court.  Attorney David L. Christian not in court.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Court enters NG Plea to Count 3.  OFF THE RECORD:  DEF to report to Justice Point for testing.   9:32 AM  BACK ON THE RECORD:  Justice Point give results, positive results.  DEF makes statement,  Justice Point Representative makes statement.    DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Petition for Leave to File Additional Motions
MOTION FOR DISCOVERY AND DEMAND FOR PRODUCTION OF DOCUMENTS

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

11:04AM DEF Mariah R. Trepania in court, appearing by video from in custody in Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Gabriel Pollak (special appearance) appearing by video.  Kenneth Sortedahl appearing by video for the State of WI.    Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  DEF qualifies for public defender appointment.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Pollak argues bond.  Court sets bond.  Court notes probation hold, sets initial appearance for 6/14/22 at 8:30AM.
